poem:
### Empire of Trolleys

These aisles once echoed  
with the clink of coins,  
now ghostly whispers  
of profit margins float.  
A harvest unseen,  
peasants counting pennies  
as a firm  
feasts on figures.  
Growth, they call it.  
But in fields now fallow,  
no golden wheat,  
only the withered leaves  
of promises.
